files.description: Defines the Python package metadata, dependencies, CLI entrypoint, formatting/linting tool settings, and pytest configuration for a reproducible pipeline.
Runs continuous integration on pushes and pull requests including linting, unit tests, and minimal smoke execution of the CLI pipeline.
Implements continuous delivery by building and publishing a versioned Python package artifact (and optionally a GitHub Release) on tagged commits.
Documents the mission, scientific scope, installation, CLI usage examples, data-model conventions, and how to run simulations and inference end-to-end.
Initializes the dgpipe package, exposes the public API surface, and centralizes version information.
Provides a complete command-line interface to generate protocols, run simulations, and execute statistical inference with saved outputs and provenance metadata.
Implements a prioritized library of concrete measurement protocols for correlators and entanglement diagnostics across analogue platforms and astrophysical probes with machine-readable schemas.
Defines discrete-gravity-inspired effective models (e.g., causal-set/discrete-spectrum motivated propagators and dispersion relations) and their mappings to observable correlators.
Runs controlled numerical and semi-analytical simulations to quantify finite-size, discretization, and dispersive systematics for each protocol and produces synthetic datasets.

Implements a statistical inference strategy (likelihoods, nuisance/systematics marginalization, Bayesian posterior sampling and/or frequentist fits) translating measured data into constraints on discrete-structure parameters.
Handles robust I/O for configs, datasets, results, and provenance (JSON/CSV/NPZ), including schema validation and deterministic seeding for reproducibility.
End-to-end smoke tests ensuring protocol generation, simulation, and inference run deterministically and produce valid outputs under CI constraints.

missionDescription: Develop an integrated theoretical-to-experimental pipeline connecting discrete-gravity microstructure (causal sets, discrete spectra) to measurable signatures in analogue platforms and astrophysical probes. Produce a prioritized set of concrete measurement protocols for correlators and entanglement diagnostics, a plan for controlled numerical/analytical simulations quantifying finite-size and dispersive systematics, and a statistical-inference strategy to translate measured data into constraints on discrete-structure parameters.
missionSuccessCriteria: Concrete diagnostic protocols: A prioritized list (â‰¥3) of explicit experimental observables and measurement procedures (e.g., two-point correlators, spectral/entanglement measures, noise-statistics) mapped to specific discrete-microstructure model parameters, including required measurement resolution and sample sizes.

Simulation plan: A detailed plan for controlled simulations (numerical and/or analytical) that quantifies leading finite-size and dispersive/systematic effects, specifying numerical methods, boundary conditions, parameter ranges, and targeted accuracy (e.g., <10% systematic uncertainty) for each observable.

Statistical inference design: A workable inference pipeline (likelihood structure, priors, nuisance-parameter treatment, and summary statistics) that translates simulated/observed data into posterior constraints on discrete-structure parameters, including proposed hypothesis tests and a plan for incorporating experimental noise and calibration errors.

Prioritization and deliverables: A ranked list of near-term (feasible within current analogue platforms) vs medium-term (requires advanced control) experiments, plus explicit next steps and resource estimates (compute/time/experimental) to implement the top-priority protocol.
